Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Five Stars
Review: Love it and would definitely recommend.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Got it for my sister, she loved it.
Review: I honestly have no idea what this product does but I never stopped hearing my sister tell me how it worked miracles for her.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Four Stars
Review: I love carols daughter I've been using it for about 5 years won't use anything else

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Five Stars
Review: Love this product very good for my hair

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Reliable outcome.
Review: The product met my expectations.  I see an improvement in my hair, I am getting the results I hoped for.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Great for my hair!
Review: I just got this product a few days ago and already plan to reorder when I run out of it.  I am really pleased with it.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Two Stars
Review: The last time I received this order from Amazon, it was rank.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Five Stars
Review: The best hair cream

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Three Stars
Review: I like the product. thanks

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Overscented
Review: This product is WAY overscented.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Good texture and consistency
Review: Good texture and consistency, but the fragrance is much too strong and rather unpleasant.  it isn't patchouli..but something similar.  Impossible for anyone to wear in a work environment without overpowering those around you.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Five Stars
Review: The best leave in condition and styling product in one. Excellent

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Works well!
Review: This is my second purchase of this product [one from Amazon and one from a retailer].  I like it a lot for the way I am wearing my hair presently, which is all natural.  I did not like it as well when I first purchased it because my hair was straight and it was too heavy and weighty for the hair.  Works best on hair that is not permed.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Four Stars
Review: Not for my hair type!

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: The product itself delivers what it promises, however, ...
Review: The product itself delivers what it promises, however, it is too overpriced.  Was able to later purchase two for the price ofone of the one purchased from you.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Looked like it was used
Review: Looked like it was used

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: LOVE! I have thick, untreated hair but it gets very dry even though I only wash it once a week. I take a dime sized amount, rub it around in my hands, and then slowly swipe it through the ends and work my way up to my scalp so that it distributes evenly. I've found that I can make sure it is distributed more evenly when my hair is dry. It is easy to use too much and then look a little greasy, but just start small and you'll find the right amount for you.I love the healthy shine that it gives my hair. I reapply after 3 days (so I use it twice in between washings), and it helps tame my wisps and broken hair along my hairline. I also have been putting it in my 3 yro and 1 yro's hair every few days! It gives their hair a little bit of weight so that I can style it easier (also gives it a beautiful shine). It has a delicate smell of shea butter, and it smells slightly different once applied on me and my two daughters. All pleasant! I am such a fan of this product and this tub will last us a long time!

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: OK creame conditioner.
Review: Its an OK product. Lets talk about all the pros first.1. Tiny bit goes a long way - yes just a little product is good for my hair. I have almost wait length and its thick.2. Smells delicious3. I used it on dry hair and wet hair and it did make my hair smooth and manageableBUT,(con below)1. I couldn't straighten my hair after i applied this - even though the product says you can use this in both wet and dry hair and style anyway we normally would, I wasn't able to straighten my hair after once I applied this cream. My hair turned very oily  and it clumped together. I did this in the morning so i couldn't wash my hair after but if i had time i would have washed my hair because it was not pretty :(It may seem like 1 con vs 3 pros but the con is a big one and so i am sad to say i will not be purchasing this product and wouldn't recommend it if you plan on using a hair straighter,

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: We've used Carol's Daughter products, off and on, for several years. It used to be for high quality product and mixed hair this was it (and and Jessie's). However, with the new plethora of choices Carol's Daughter has a higher standard to live up too. It does not consistently do that - and this is a "it's ok" but not a stellar product. We use several different products including Shea Moisture, Lush, and Karen's Body Beautiful -- to name a few. This fits somewhere in the middle. It is thick but if you don't get the amount correct it can cause your hair to feel oily vs. feeling moisturized. We don't find that it does much beyond a day - and my daughter washes her hair only 1-2x a week as it is so incredibly dry doing so more frequently leaves her with straw hair. For a mixed 3A/3B hair that looks a lot like pipe cleaners twisted up I'd go with this for more occasional use. Perhaps a 3C/4A type hair would do better with it on the daily.We've used earlier versions of this and they seemed to moisturize better - this was about 3 years ago. This one looks the same but acts different.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: I have thick, type-4 natural hair. My hair ...
Review: I have thick, type-4 natural hair. My hair is highlighted and gets extremely dry. I use this product to moisturize my hair and seal with Carol's Daughter Hair Balm.  I mist my hair lightly with water, use a small amount of this to moisturize the hair, and then use a dab of the Hair Balm to seal. I stretch my hair overnight and in the morning my hair is soft and ready to style. The softness lasts all day. I've been natural for almost 3 years and I just "discovered" this product. If you have high-shrinkage, crunchy hair, buy this and use it with the Hair Balm. I'm ready to get rid of all my other products.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This was my first experience with any of Marguerite's Magic.  I am black and I have natural 4b and 4c hair.  Basically my hair is course, curly and coily.  It's dry and hard to manage.  I have to have moisturizing and conditioning hair products.  I tried the Carol's Daughter Monoi set and I found it to be extremely drying on my hair.  My hair felt stripped.  I had a hard time doing anything with it even when it was wet.  I also had relaxed hair at the time, so it shouldn't have been hard to comb, but it was so bad that I almost pulled my hair out just by combing it.  My daughter also tried it and had terrible results and she wore her hair natural.  We both had the same experience, so I wasn't sure about Carol's Daughter products.  After I saw the reviews I decided to try this product and I was pleasantly surprised.  It didn't dry my hair.  It actually softened my hair.  I also used it when I twisted my hair.  It was also good for that.  It has a very thick consistency.  You don't need to use a lot of it to get good results.  The scent is nice and not very strong.  I can't think of one thing that I didn't like about this.  I will continue to use this and I would recommend it to anyone that need moisturizing hair cream.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Rich and Creamy Moisture for Over Styled Hair
Review: I you have really dry this works like magic.  I have tried it on dry hair but thought it was a bit too greasy looking, but using it after shampooing on clean wet under any other product (or alone) leaves hair soft and manageable while reducing the appearance of split ends. I tend to really process my hair, color it, blow dry straighten it, use curling irons, etc which makes it pretty dry and brittle, so this is a nice product for repairing it. You don't have to use very much, I have only short to medium length hair and use about a 1/4 tsp of this product so it lasts a long time.  My one complaint when first purchasing this product was that it was incredibly hard to read the tiny green print on the jar, I had to borrow reading glasses to make out what it said.  Over all I think this is a great product.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Mixed opinion
Review: I purchased this product several months ago when I was transitioning, i.e. growing out my relaxer.  When I was transitioning, it made my new growth softer and more manageable, and my relaxed hair less dry and more moisturized.  Now that I am fully natural, I have a different opinion.  I have used this product many times, and on both wet, freshly-shampooed and dry hair.  I have used it as a leave-in before applying a styler, and have used it over a styler.  While on initial application, the hair is soft and shiny, these attributes, at least in my experience, are not long-lasting.  I find that by the end of the day, my hair has lost its luster, and feels rather crunchy.  My mother, who is natural, and who presses her hair, really likes this product.  I think, at least for me as an African-American, that this product works better on relaxed hair, or on pressed, natural hair.  So, I don't plan on tossing it; it's much too expensive for that. LOL!  When I press my hair, I will give the product a try.The thing that I find rather peculiar about Carol's Daughter hair care products is this: Lisa Price claims that they are designed for all hair types and textures.  I don't think that this is the case.  I think that some hair types and textures have better success with Carol's Daughter's products than others.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Not well suited for my hair or my daughter's
Review: My daughter and I have essentially the same hair.  It's brown, thick and curly and will frizz up pretty easily.  It generally looks best when the hair clumps together smoothly instead of turning into a bushy mess.  I was hoping this stuff would provide that additional moisture while remaining non-greasy.  Unfortunately, even a small amount just makes our hair look greasy and unwashed.  I also don't find the smell pleasing.My son has straight-wavy blonde hair and looks good when his hair has a little wet look.  For that type of hair, this stuff seems to be good.  However, his hair is so manageable that it's also unnecessary to use any product.I don't really think this is a bad product, but it just doesn't work for me.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have very very dry hair. Unreasonably dry, is how I would really classify it.  I have tried several products for dry hair, but because they are oily, they just make my hair oily initially, then it goes right back to being dry. I found that to be the case with another product that called it self, "restorative"  What's different about this product is that it's a paste, rather than an oil.  This means that you have to work the product into your hair more throughly then you would an oil.  I found that it made a huge improvement. I looks healthier and more is manageable.  I wish it had a better scent. Will replenish when it runs out.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: I have thick 3c/4a hair, and I've been struggling ...
Review: I have thick 3c/4a hair, and I've been struggling to find a product that moisturizes. I've recently went natural, and my natural hair has quite a few textures; I've tried various leave-ins and creams, but nothing has worked well for me. I was apprehensive about how thick the cream is, especially after trying the pantene gold series leave in butter, but this works wonders; my hair went from frizzy to defined curls in the short time I've been using this product. My curls have not been this moisturized or defined for a long time. I use this product along with Chi silk oil and the pantene gold series conditioner, but after trying this product I'm going to switch to Carol's daughter shampoo/conditioners.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: This is fun to work with for more silkier styles......
Review: For me, just a little goes a long way. I sometimes want a different, more shinier look and this does the trick. Just a dab in dry hair gives it a glossy shine and it smells nice. I am also able to get my hair to stay better and tame a few cow licks which have gone wild with age. I have recommended this to many as I think it works great and is easily available on amazon. Try it !

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: works on naturally straight hair too
Review: I have lots of natural straight blonde hair that is extremely prone to dryness, breakage, and split ends. I never blow dry,  straighten, or process it any way; my hair is just naturally brittle and dry.Anyways I've been searching forever to find something... And this may be it! Here are the pros and con's:Pros:A tiny bit goes a long way, about 1/2 tsp is enough for all my ends (@ target this is only $12 so its a great value) I predict the 8 oz jar will last around 6 months, maybe more.Makes my hair shiny, smooth, and manageable! Not greasy or limp!My hair is growing again! Hair isn't breaking off as much!Great scent, does not irritate my skin or scalp allergiesReduces # of split endsDoes not discolor my blonde hair like many like products do.Con's:Isn't a permenant fix, the next day I still have to use it again to get the same effectIf youre not careful and add too much it can leave a film on your hair. However, it is easy to figure out how much you need and it won't leave a film unless you really put way too much in.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Not for my natural hair
Review: I have used this product years ago when it first came out.  I used to use it on my daughter's natural, 4c type hair and on my own locs.  Back then,  I stopped using it because it created a flaky buildup in our hair and did not moisturize as well as I had hoped.  I decided to try it again because I have had success with other Carol's Daughter products.  Unfortunately, I have had the same experience.  I used some on my locs and noticed that within hours, my hair felt crunchy rather than moisturized.  I'm not sure whose hair this is "magic" for, but I would say it's likely not best on natural, 4b/c type hair.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: It's thicker than the silicone based products like Frizzease serum (which is what I usually use)
Review: This is a nice-smelling hair dressing. When I first opened it, I forgot it was for hair, and I put some on my face, haha. But, it actually does make my skin feel softer too (I've noticed this about hair conditioners - they often can do double duty as skin softeners or shaving cream). It's thicker than the silicone based products like Frizzease serum (which is what I usually use), but it doesn't seem to make my hair feel greasy, even while it *does* make it feel softer and not as dry and crunchy. My hair gets very dry and crunchy in the winter, so I think this will be a product I will continue to use.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: This works well to help me attain second day curls ...
Review: This works well to help me attain second day curls. It is a cream, a thick cream, which I only need apply a little of. I apply to my dry hair and rub through my curls, scrunching and fluffing as I go. The first time I used it I used too much and it made my hair look very heavy. It is strongly scented but the scent fades quickly. My daughter, who has 4A curls can apply to her damp hair and achieve a more stretched out curl look. Her hair has incredible shrinkage and this combats that. This is an expensive product but for the amount we use daily I can see it lasting 2 months, maybe more.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Silly me
Review: I often thought that with the abundance of oil and natural products I was putting on my hair that it was well moisturized, even though some oils would not be dissolved into my hair too well leaving me with an oily face :-/ YIKES! Well anyway, I decided to try CD's Marguerite's Magic after reading all of the reviews and what I thought was moisturized hair truly transformed into something wonderful. After applying to my scalp and ends--Instantly my hair was softer, shinier, and well manageable by allowing me to comb/brush with little to no breakage AND it even softened my new growth tremendously. My main purpose for purchasing this product is because I want to turn up my workout and I sweat heavily on my scalp. We all know that sweat includes salt and salt dries out anything especially hair and I don't want my hair to become a reason for me to not be in the best shape of my life. Tomorrow starts a new workout regime which includes daily running and strengthening, I'll come back to let you all know how or if this product remains "magical"...so far so great, I'm in love already!!update: So I have been working out more intensely and this product still keeps my hair smooth, moisturized, shiny, and manageable after working out. After I workout my hair is always wet. I just apply a little MM (a little goes a long way) and wrap it up for the moment. Once I begin to get ready for work I unwrap my hair and you would have never thought that I worked out that morning. This is a keeper in my book.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I color-treat my short, curly hair, and it tends to be dry and flyaway. I tried this leave-in conditioner, hoping to tame the frizz.It certainly did that, but a bit more than I needed. My curls are defined, which is good, but they have too much shine -- they look oily, like I haven't washed my hair in awhile. I didn't use very much of the product, either. I got some really odd looks from friends when I used it.I'll give it another try when my hair grows out a little, but at this point I think this conditioner is more firepower than I need.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Works very well on my wavy, dry, colored hair
Review: I tend to have very dry hair, and I color it as well. It's longer, down below my shoulders, and quite wavy. So I was excited to see this and give it a try. I've been a fan of Carol's Daughter products for quite a while, though it's been a long time since I actually used any. This, I really like.I put it on damp hair and let my hair air-dry. I get very little frizz, and my hair truly does feel softer than it has in ages. It's very thick, like a paste, and a little bit goes a long way. The only downside, but one that I happily overlook, is the slightly...musty...smell of the product. It's hard to describe, really - it's not *bad*, but it's not fruity fresh, either. However, and Carol's Daughter products tend to be reasonably natural, I'm going to assume that is why. And since my hair really has shown improvement since I started using this, I'm totally OK overlooking the slight odor (which, btw, goes away after the hair is dry).Overall, I definitely like the softness of my hair using this, and the jar I have will last for quite some time. If you have overly-processed hair, then it's worth a try!

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: My first CD product
Review: **I ended up returning the product because I found better and more cost-effective alternative for myself. But my experiences were still positive; maybe this will help someone.I used this on clean damp hair. I used just a tiny bit, emulsified it between my palms, and smoothed it on a small section of hair, then twisted my hair. I made 20 medium twists.My medium twists came out shiny and healthy looking. If you are making small to medium sized twists/braids, just use a touch per section.The next day my twists were beautiful. Two days later I unraveled to re moisturize and re twist. My hair was shiny, healthy, and fluffy, with a uniform pattern. I used just a touch of creme on each section to moisturize for the day, then twisted back up.A week later on clean hair, I used a lot more product to do 6 large twists (about a quarter size for entire head) on damp hair. My hair responded well and is moisturized, shiny, and soft while twisted up. It's winter here so I don't plan on wearing a twist out until summer, but whenever I take my twists down to remoisturize I like the results.It has a pleasant, light scent. I have a sensitive nose, and it doesn't give me problems. It is VERY thick. A little goes a long way. I think I will only use this the first time I two strand twist my hair, then every other day or more. I would not put it all over your hair every single day.I really like this stuff. The consistency really throws me off, though. I plan to use it for when I twist and to moisturize twists, but it also works well as a normal moisturizer sans twisting. Works great paired with the M. Honey, which I used on my ends only.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Great Detangler and Great for Natural to Straight Styles
Review: It's a bit oily, so you have to use it sparingly, but it's a great detangler. I have natural hair and if I want to wear a straight style, I blow dry my hair, then put on a little Marguerite's Magic.  Then, I can comb through my hair and straighten it with a flat iron or curl it. I also use it as a detangler before I wash my hair.  I part my hair in sections, then put this on (heavy), then put conditioner on.  I let it sit overnight or for a hour or so and then I shampoo.  My hair is detangled until my next shampoo.  Caution: when I wear my hair naturally curly and use a curly pudding or some sort of koily creme, I don't use this product at all because my hair can't get curly with it. It's detangled, but it flattens my natural curl pattern.  Other than that, I like the product.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Moisturizing Creme
Review: I use this on my 10yo daughters natural kinky/coily thick hair, honestly its the only product we have tried that actually softens and moisturizes her hair. it has a really nice smell, which she likes-bonus! i apply it to hair and scalp at night and wrap her hair up. in the morning her hair is not so tangled, she's a wild sleeper. All in all it is a good product and it works for her hair. With anything it's trial and error, for the past two years now this has remained a staple in her hair reg.I would recommend buying this.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Leaves Hair Very Soft
Review: This is rich, creamy, and as the label implies, a little does go a very long way. Using too much could easily weigh hair down and make it rather greasy. That said, using the right amount will leave hair quite soft, moisturized, and will last for a few days without needing a reapplication. The only thing I don't love about it is the scent--while it's not strong or unpleasant, it's also not all that pleasant either. Recommended for natural, kinky/coily hair.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I use this for all-natural non-relaxed hair. The results are great.  It softens and makes my hair less frizzy and much easier to style.  The consistency is not too thick or heavy and it doesn't weigh my hair down nor harden it.  The scent is moderate and falls in the take it or leave it department.  Luckily, I don't mind it.  It's a nice daily hair cream for keeping a nice neat 'do, even if you have untreated hair.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Creamy, rich, thick, moisturizing, great-smelling, goodness! My daughter's hair loves this cream. After a good wash, I slather (her hair is super thick), on this cream and it her hair drinks this up. Her hair tends to tangle and snarl, to the point of dreading up after I wash her hair, but this cream keeps her hair from drying out and there are zero tangles.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: I have very dry brittle ends due to a bleach ...
Review: I have very dry brittle ends due to a bleach job and constant use of a flat iron so I've been putting this directly on that.  I'm really not noticing any difference though and this makes my hair not cooperate with my styling tools.  My hair is just greasy but doesn't feel any better.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Thick and rich and worth the price
Review: I love to use this cream on my wet hair when I wear it curly. My hair is relaxed and past my shoulders and this product works for me because it's thick, but a little goes a long way. It coats my hair while its wet and gives it more weight as it dries (which in my opinion is a good thing because throughout my day there are no fly-aways).Again, a little goes a long way because it it pretty dense, but there is a nice smooth creaminess to it which makes it easy to apply. The fragrance is light and I just feel like my hair is protected when I go out into the elements (I live in Michigan and the cold winds can be brutal on hair).

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: This leave-in product makes my hair look and feel greasy, even when I use a small amount and work/comb it through my hair.  The smell is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.  Although I don't have over-processed hair, I had hoped that this would help my winter dry fly-away hair be more manageable.  Instead, it weighs it down.  It makes blonde hair look darker.  The best part of this, and why I gave it an extra star, is what it doesn't contain.  It has no petrolatum, no mineral oil, no parabens, no silicone, no artificial colors.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have 3B curls and very dry hair.  My water is also hard so I a hard time finding something that will moisturize my curls.  This helped to bring some softness to my curls and added some moisture.  I find it works best if I section off my hair in four parts and apply it followed by a curl enhancer.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Good moisturizer
Review: This is a good moisturizer. It refreshes my twist out without weighing it down or making it greasy. It also has a pleasant scent. I don’t have any complaints about it.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Good for old guys as well as for women
Review: I quite realize that this is meant to  be a woman's product, but as an jold guy who still has a healthy head of hair, I dind this great for giving these old hairs a fine shiny look.  So I recommend it to all oldsters still lucky enough to have healthy heads of hair.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Perfect for dry and brittle hair
Review: This is the only product I have found that actually works on my hair. I have very dry, brittle hair and this product always leave my twist outs moisturizer, and full of volume. I always receive compliments on my hair after using this product. I have tried so many other products (to cut cost), but I always end up coming back to this!

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: This is a good product I use for my Childrens hair because it ...
Review: This is a good product I use for myChildrens hair because it works better with natural hair then chemical treatmented hair... I find it to be to heavy for my hair and it smells really good.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Moisture Rich
Review: My daughters curly hair stays moisturized and healthy.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: We love this stuff for our kinky caucasian hair
Review: We love this stuff for our kinky caucasian hair. Don't use too much or it looks greasy. We do not frizz even when we sleep on our curls!

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Nice hair softener
Review: I like the consistency if this product. The smell is fresh and clean too

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: It's OK!
Review: I have tried several of CD's products and most have just been OK, or did absolutely nothing special for my hair and even at times seemed like it was making things worse for my hair.  However, there have been a few that I think work and does what it says, and this is 1.  I am transitioning from relaxed to natural and it just seemed to sit on my hair, not absorb. However, S of M M works best in my opinion to smooth down edges and flyaways while adding sheen.  It really works best in my daughters hair (3yrs old) which is naturally curly and delicate.  It holds her flyaways nicely and keeps her hair looking neat with no frizzies. A little goes a long way though, because if too much is used it does tend to be too heavy on the hair and will leave product build up. Try it, it just may work for you.

Title: exactly what my oldest daughter's hair needed

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Happy customer
Review: Great product.  I use mine for my L.O.C. I also use Carol Daughters leave in conditioner as part of my L.O.C regime.  It leaves a beautiful shine.  Softness and takes a lot of frizz away. Ive also noticed little breakage after wash day. I am very heavy handed with products but once you get the hang of them you will realize that a little goes a very long way.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: BEST HAIR CARE FOR ME!!!
Review: I'm a woman who is Austrian, Swedish and Black. Growing up my family all tried to do my hair. My black grandma Daisy straightened it like she did my big sisters with natural black hair. Worked for them, my hair fell out. My white mom who did my hair everyday used the best curly hair products available for that time (the 70s). Worked if she everyday for school I had a ponytail or two. (Everyone called me Buffy from Family Affair, the popular tv show at the time.) That was cool! But as I got older I wanted to express myself and my unique spirit. But it presented some real issues as there were no good products for my hair needs. But then the industry FINALLY recognized that BLACK hair was also ETHNIC hair and there was a HUGE market for it. And FINALLY we were blessed with CAROL'S DAUGHTER PRODUCTS!!! AMEN TWO TIMES!!!! SHE MADE US FEEL FREE AND A PART OF A STORY ABOUT OUR OWN LIVES!!! AND, YES, IT MADE US FEEL FREE AND OH SO VERY BEAUTIFUL!!! SO TO ANYONE WHO KNOWS WHAT I AM SAYING... PUT YOUR HANDS UP IN THE AIR FOR THIS AMAZING WOMAN AND HER AWESOME ENTREPRENEURIAL SPIRIT!!!

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: A little greasy
Review: I like this product. It smells amazing and really does make my hair soft but it was a little greasy on my hair. I mean I followed the instructions but three days after one use my hair was greasy to the touch. My hair is dry so it gets moisture in the initial use of the cream. I like it at the beginning but am not a fan of the days that follow. I didn't use it on my scalp so I can't tell you how that works. It's still a good product though.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: why are u even reading the reviews. buy it!!
Review: OH MY GODDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD!!!!!!!!!!!! please ! please just buy it. it smells like absolute HEAVEN! it smells like HEAVEENNNN! it’s so soft and everything and when you apply it—it makes ur hair looks soft and wet—in a good way. please girl just buy it.

Product: Carol's Daughter Marguerite's Magic Restorative Cream, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: I jacked mt hair up... this fixed it
Review: So, look. I know it was dumb, I do but its quarantine, so who cares? I've dyed and bleached my hair multiple times in my life but this was the dumbest thing I've EVER done. During a little fit on identity crisis and a desire for a rebrand, I bleached my 4b hair -- TWICE in one sitting in preparation for some semi perm dye. Okay, stop right there. I know, I know! I'm paying for it right now. My super defined coils loosened from the first dye but my hair was still dark in some places. So, I bleached it again. I KNOW! My curls went straight like I permed them. I thought nothing of it as I continued to watch Assassination Classroom on Hulu (get into it). The dye didn't even stick. My hair started breaking. My hair turned blue, then green and my little cousin said I looked like Sonic the Hedgehog. I used a permanent box dye I had in my drawer as an emergency use only situation and it left my hair parched. So now I was left with short, broken off strands of hair every time I went to detangle or TOUCH my hair. I usually don't care about hair mistakes but this felt HUGE. I almost cried. I ran to my bathroom and started doing a protein treatment, followed by a coconut oil and banana hair mask, then I slapped some of this proudcut in and my hair felt... nourished. I'm still in the process of repairing my hair but this feels so good and makes my hair feel like its being deepy moisturized and has a protective barrier over it. My hair is soft and feels less dry and brittle, though I still have breakage right now. But I feel like if I keep the protein treatments up, followed by this magic potion, I'll be good in no time. And for all the people clutching their pearls at my mistake, I swore off bleach for good this time cause I obviously can't trust myself.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Broke my scalp out!!
Review: I have locs and dry scalp.  Was looking for a oil to moisturize my scalp and locs.  I used this product for 3 days and it broke my scalp out.  It smells great but it is very greasy and it caused my scalp to become very irritated and itchy.  I think I had a allergic reaction to the oil.  I stopped using it and my scalp had patches of dry skin and scabs.  I’ve never had my scalp itch so bad.  You can see how red and irritated my scalp was and this was after 3 days of using oil.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: I have very fine hair but a lot of it and this stuff ...
Review: I have very fine hair but a lot of it and this stuff is amazing. I've been using organic oils on my hair for the last year and a half bc I live in Spain and the water over here really is hard for your hair and scalp. I noticed a few months after when moved that I was starting to get dandruff, itchy scalp, and brittle hair. I was freaking out thinking I had head lice one week bc I couldn't itching. My husband was laughing at me of course so I decided to try different shampoos and oil treatments to help. I actually found this product while visiting my mom on vacation 4 months ago at Wal-Mart in cultural hair aisle. I grab it up while my mom was saying it wouldn't work on my hair. Needless to say a week after I bought it it worked wonders for my scalp.  At first I used it once a week for 10 min then I changed it up to twice a week for 30 .....still my scalp was getting flaky so I started reading online about adding heat to scalp for oil treatments for an hour once or twice a week. So now that I'm back in Spain I actually have to use this 2x weekly for an hour with heat and I use need oil hair mask once in between these two treatments. This vanilla hair oil is the only oil that actually gives my hair volume everything else I've tried makes my hair so oily I have to wear it up. The need oil treatments helps balance with the brittle issue locking in the moisture better and relieves my itchy scalp. Hope this helps you guys  and remember when traveling to different countries make sure to carry extra hair treatments....the water isn't like USA.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: EDIT: Formula has changed - I like it even more
Review: I use this product on my hands while scrunching out my gel cast. I wish I could just bathe in it because it smells so good.Edit 6/3/2020 - the formula has changed. The photo on the listing was changed to "softening hair oil" but I received "replenishing hair oil" which is still different from my previous bottle which reads "pure hair oil." I'm not sure why the packaging label differs so much but it's obvious they have been tweaking the formula. I noticed that looking at the ingredients several things have been added that are not updated here. According to curls bot, ingredients are still CG friendly.My hair likes this formula better. I am a 2b/2c wavy that had to really be careful with the old formula to prevent weighing down. I still use a tiny pea size dot but it seems to feel lighter on my hair, and is easier to distribute. My hair feels even softer than before and very moisturized. Many thanks to this brand!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Instantly made my hair gross
Review: I used this product 3 times before finally giving up. I have fine hair that I use oil on regularly without any issues as long as I apply on the light side. When  I used this oil I used a quarter, then a penny, then a dime sized amount one per trial. It made my hair look like I hadn't washed it in days. It collected dandruff flakes and generally just left my hair feeling greasy and stringy instead of silky or smooth. I wanted this to work out because the ingredients fall in line with all my stipulations but it just didn't.Good amount of product, smelled kind of like vanilla body spray, so not good but not bad.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Seems to work okay, but I'm tired enough of vanilla not to buy anymore
Review: It seems to work okay, though I've only used it once because I'm not a fan of the smell of vanilla. Since L'Oreal took control of the company, the unique scents that Carol's Daughter use to carry have been discontinued. So many products I need are made with vanilla that I wonder if the company gets some kind of unbeatable deal on it. Or maybe it's part of their strategy to limit our choices.I won't be buying any more.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Hydrates hair, but can weigh it down.
Review: Bought this for my mom to replace her HASK oil. She has fine, small curls that sometimes break into waves. Lots of damage from heat tools and chemical processes, especially bleaching and lightening. She first put on damp hair, and was worried that it was too greasy. But as the day progressed, she loved how hydrated, shiny, and manageable her hair was. Her main issue with this oil is that it makes her hair flat and feels heavy. However, it’s not thick like honey, more like between olive and grape seed oil. She’s not crazy about the smell as she loves fresh, flowery scents - but I’m loving it. It’s more on the spicy and woody side. Decent amount of product for the price.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: I love this scent!
Review: I LOVE this product. It smells heavenly, it moisturizes my thick, 4c hair and gives it a gorgeous shine. I love it because it doesn't leave my hair smelling like hair grease. I think they changed the formula some, because the scent seems a lot stronger- which I prefer. Its very good for seperating twists, bantu knots, or braid-outs. It does sit on your hair, keepong the moisture locked in.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Smells Delicious. I am obsessed.
Review: This product smells so good. I love this brand’s line of black vanilla products. Words cannot describe how good these products smell. Seriously.A little bit of this oil goes a long way. It is not to thick so it can be used everyday or as needed.If your on the fence, I would say go ahead and buy it. It’s hard to find hair products that smell like vanilla.Btw the product came full and in tact in the mail. The picture is after I have used the product for awhile.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Great for locs
Review: I've been using this product on my locs for over a year now, and it's great. It absorbs wonderfully, isn't too heavy, gives them a gorgeous shine, and is never greasy. I usually break out from oils used in my hair, but I haven't had any breakouts when using this product. I absolutely love the smell. I use it on my scalp as well as on the locs themselves. My locs are past my bottom, and one bottle lasts a month even when sharing with my husband. Highly recommend you give it a try!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Follow the directions! Great product!
Review: First i have to say read the directions! It says to apply to hair and let it sit for a few minutes then rinse and shampoo/condition and wash your hair. All the bad reviews are from people just putting it in their hair and leaving it throughout the day. It is meant to be used as a pre-wash!This product absolutely smells amazing!! Im obsessed with vanilla, the smell is really concentrated so from the bottle smells a little candle-like but after you put it in your hair it is pure blisss! And definately adds softness over-time.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: I love this stuff - hair, body, face
Review: I had been buying this at Target, but they were out so I looked here.  About the same price, so pulled the trigger.  I  love this stuff so much - I mix it with conditioner (any kind) for my hair, and I use it all over my body in the shower after I rinse cleanser but right before I shave.  I put it everywhere, even places I don't shave, but I don't need a separate shave gel/lotion.  Rinsing off will still leave a bit on your skin which for me is excellent especially in the winter.  It also is amazing to put on right before I self-tan.  Just a little, not too much, and it almost acts like a primer for my tanning mousse or spray with bronzer.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)

It gives my natural curly hair a lift and it looks so healthy. This will now replace the mousse I've used for years.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)

Review: This oil was too heavy for my hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Shiny happy curls
Review: I spent many years fighting my natural curl, brushing and pulling it straight, aggravated with the texture and constant frizz. Embracing my curls have been a journey, one that has brought a variety of products into my life and daily routine. I loosely follow the curly girl method, and am always happy to find cg approved products to try and was really excited to try this brand as it is new to me. I use this oil two ways. The first is as a weekly oil treatment, the steam of the shower makes the scent stronger and really nice. The second way I use it is off label, I put a small amount in my hand, warm it with my palms and use it to break the gel cast on my hair once my hair is fully dry post shower. I enjoy the vanilla scent and the way it lingers in my hair without competing with the other scents I use. Both ways I use this oil help keep my hair hydrated and my curls soft and ridiculously shiny without weighing my hair down or giving it an oil feel or look. Not every new product I try stays in my routine but this one definitely will be as I'm extremely happy with the results.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: (First off, the artificial fragrance in this is a migraine trigger for many people. Just FYI in case you're migraine prone)The first ingredient is corn oil, but corn oil is not ideal for hot oil treatments.The best thing for hot oil treatments is coconut oil. In fact, if you are looking for oils for your hair, and can work with coconut, that's one of the most nourishing things you can use. The challenge with coconut is that it's hard/solid at room temperature (coagulates), so you need to keep it slightly warm, or if it's cold, use it like a wax/balm.For me, my hair gets frizzy along with conditioners, so I add a few drops of essential oils to my shampoo, then massage a few drops into my scalp after my hair is dry. It feels great, makes my scalp and hair look healthy with a nice sheen, and reduces dandruff significantly. It also helps hide grays.That's how I use this vanilla oil - a few drops in my shampoo. But it appears to be 95-99% vegetable oils, which might cosmetically add a shine to your hair, and maybe a little softness and a few nourishing vitamins, but it's not going to do a whole lot. I typically prefer essential oils.The smell is very strong, but fewer than approx 2 drops per application doesn't seem to bother me. Even if you're not migraine prone, I could never imagine using an ounce or two for a hot oil, it's very smelly.If you're looking for nourishing oils, there are a lot of inexpensive options (you only need a few drops): Try coconut oil, Argan oil of Morocco, or Almond oil, all of which can be used straight. For scalp stimulation and hair growth try a few drops of Cedarwood oil (should be mixed with a carrier, like 50/50 Almond oil, and also it's been called a masculine smell, it's going to smell woodsy and a bit musky). Or Chamomile oil will help repair damaged skin (also mix with carrier oil, and it's a subtle flowery smell).

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Best Oil Ever! Smell is to die for!
Review: I FREAKING LOVE THIS OIL! I stopped being a fan of Carol's Daughter many moons ago. She sold her company off and it just was no longer for African American hair. I ordered from that company when they were a little place in Brooklyn and all her items had to be kept refrigerated so I was there at the beginning. But then one time I used a product and it turned my hair into straw. So I stayed away from all of her items. BUT somehow in my all my natural hair product junkie tendencies I decided to give this one a try. This smells SO FREAKING AMAZING! And I love the oil mixture. It doesn't have soybean oil or some other odd mixture. I am HERE for the ingredients. Anytime I place this in my hair it's like people are much closer talking to me just to get a whiff of this scent. I smell it so I know others do as well. The smell isn't overpowering and I just enjoy it. And I am a product junkie and have laid my hands on many products but I have to say this top's it in hair oils.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Carols Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine hair oil is amazing.Did I say amazing?The smell first, is divine.  It made my hair smell so good and the smell lasted through styling and sleeping.  I can even smell this product on my pillow.That said, DO NOT USE a lot of this product at one time or your hair will be a hot mess of dripping oil and limp when dried.  Use the amount stated in the directions on the bottle because they are there for a reason. LOL  I, too, thought I knew better and had to rewash my hair to get some of the oil out because it looked greasy instead of styled.Carols Daughter also helped my split ends as well as the fly away hairs at my temple due to my wearing glasses.All in all, a great styling product that I recommend for extremely dry and frizzy hair.  Fine hair might not work as well.Natalie S. for Amazon Vine

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: It's NOT a leave-in!
Review: Ignore all the reviews about how this made their hair feel greasy. Judging by what they say, they are using this as a LEAVE IN hair oil! This product isn't meant to be used that way. It is a pre-shampoo treatment that can be used on its own or as a hot oil treatment. You're meant to put this in your hair just before you shampoo it out, or leave it in overnight. But it's not meant to be a styling product! If you have dry, brittle hair, rub this into your hair and scalp and let it sit for at least 30 minutes to an hour, then shampoo it out. It's amazing and will leave your hair soft and healthy!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I don't have overly dry or brittle hair, but I use hair oil as a preventative measure; especially as you age, hair can start looking like a mass of cornstalks. I tried Carols Daughter Black Vanilla (love that name) Hair Oil and used it like I do other hair oils. (I do not have a favorite brand in hair oil.) I add a very small amount to gently coat the roots of my hair and leave it on overnight. I do this about once, no more than twice, a week. The next day, shampooing the oil out of my hair is a snap and no residual. I've used the Carols Daughter's brand a few times and, it leaves my hair shiny and manageable.The Black Vanilla, though I love the name, and it has an appealing aroma, it is a bit strong for me. In fact, one night I had a little trouble falling asleep because the smell was so strong in my hair! Other than that, this is good stuff made with all-natural ingredients! If you are looking for a hair oil that will leave your hair shiny and soft, I would recommend Carols Daughter brand.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This has a divine smell and it leaves my hair silky and shiny.I put it on a particularly chapped section of my thumb where it gets chemicals (kitchen sink - sponge and dish detergent) on it and the skin healed quickly; this isn't the recommended application for this product, though.The first ingredient is Zea Mays (Corn) Oil, followed by Safflower Seed Oil, Calendula Officianalis Flower Extract, Chamomilla Recutita Flower Extract, and Perfume.You can use this straight out of the bottle, or you can use it warmed up. Massage into scalp and hair; shampoo.One day, my hair seemed particularly dry, so I put two drops into the palms of my hands and applied to my hair without shampooing. It tamed the flyaway hair nicely. I'm not sure if this is the intended application, but for one day only, it worked nicely.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: Reviewed by my wife: First of all: I'm enchanted by the fragrance. Intoxicating. That's where the good news ends. I found it to leave my hair feeling heavy, oily and crispy. As in, the dryness wasn't mitigated by this oil as it is with others I use, which make it seem normal and healthy when I apply them.I will say that I'm not sure what to think about the ingredients. On the one hand, it's nice that they're simple and relatively natural. On the other hand, corn oil is thick and heavy, and I struggle to feel really taken care of by paying $80 quart for it, even if it does smell really, really nice. I thought about it, and if I loved that way my hair responded to it, I'd be more than happy to do it. But, since it fails that test, it's just high priced, exotic-smelling salad oil, to me. Can't recommend it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: My step daughter is mixed and at 17 she has finally taken an interest in her hair.  She has gone on for years not moisturizing her natural locks.  She does not chemically treat her hair, she wears her hair natural.  There are a variety of oils for moisturizing, but she loves the smell of this.  I am Caucasian and use this as a hot oil treatment.  I take a small amount and transfer it to a small bottle bottle, cap it, put it in hot water, put the oil on my hair - a little dab will do ya - and wait about three minutes and rinse out.  I have fine wavy hair. I think it makes a fine hot oil treatment, maybe a little too heavy for my hair.  My step daughter really likes it, and we have gone through two bottles in a very short amount of time.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Pure Hair Oil is fantastic on my hair. Just a tiny bit goes a long way towards adding shine and manageability to my locks. The scent is very pleasing, but doesn't overwhelm at all due to the small amount of product applied. My hair stays soft and easy to brush when I use this hair oil, I no longer have the need to use typical after shampoo hair conditioners. There is no greasy or waxy build up in my hair when using this oil either, it washes clean with shampoo while still leaving a lasting effect of soft, manageable hair. I couldn't be happier with the results I'm getting.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Strong artificial vanilla scent, and heavy on the hair.
Review: Which fragrances one finds appealing and which fragrances one finds cloying......well, obviously, it's purely a question of personal preference. I like things that have a gentle vanilla scent, but I did not like this.  To me it smelled chemical and artificial, and too strident.  I did not use much of this, but I thought I smelled like bad vanilla cake, the kind with artificial vanilla flavoring.I have dry hair, and have found that a drop or two of good, light oil helps. I found this oil to be too heavy.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: TOP 500 REVIEWER
Review:
The Black Vanilla scent from Carol's Daughter is one of my all-time favorite scents, and I love using their 

Carols Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave-In Conditioner, 8 Ounce

   as a way to perk up my second- and third-day waves.  This new oil (unlike the 

Carols Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Hair Sheen, 4.3 Ounce

   is silicone-free, and it makes your hair feel so soft. It also imparts a lovely shine and scent to your hair, and I only need to use 1-2 drops on my shoulder-length hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Smells divine...and works great too
Review: First thing you notice is that this is  a very light oil.  Not heavy at all so it doesn't weigh your hair down.Second thing you notice is the scent.  Very lovely.  Smells fantastic.Third thing you notice is that it spreads evenly, controls frizz and gives a nice sheen.Fourth thing you notice is that you don't need to use too much, a drizzle about the size of a quarter will do it on 4C hair.Last thing you notice is that it helps maintain moisture til your next wash.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: It smells like vanilla ice cream
Review: This is a lovely hair deep conditioner and oil by Carol's Daughter. The scent is gentle and soft. It smells like vanilla ice cream. It has definitely helped my dry and corse hair regain some of it's moisture. I use it as a deep conditioner and have also used it after the shower as a leave in oil for blow drying. It works very well and makes me more confident in the look of my hair. It doesn't leave it greasy but I would only recommend a couple of drops as that's a perfect amount for long hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: A great hair oil, very heavily scecnted
Review: Very nice hair oil, does not feel heavy, nor leave your hair feeling greasy. Did not cause me any issues as far as breakouts or oily deposits. This is *very* perfumed. If you put even a small quarter-sized amount in your hair, you will smell it for days (or until you wash it out). It is a very nice, sweetly vanilla scent, and it does eventually calm down, but those first few hours, it's a very strong smell. I liked the scent, personally, but beware if you work in a confined area.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: I was pleased with the way my hair looked and felt after each use (which was usually every other day).
Review: I think will be one of my go-to products from now on.  I have short, silvery hair (that sounds better than gray) and it does seem to condition my hair in addition to the shine.  Gray hair has a tendency to lose its shine so I've been using different kinds of products to bring the shine back.  I use only a small drop and that's plenty which tells me these 4.3 oz. will last a long time.  That makes the cost only $2.21 an ounce....can hardly buy anything at that price.This does seem to me to do everything the company says  it will and it doesn't contain those ingredients we are told is so bad for us.  I don't even know what all of those named are so I guess I shall keep on living without them.  This product is worth your time and money so you can see for yourself what it does for your specific hair problems/needs.  I have also researched Carol's Daughter's other products and have tried one to help scrunch up your hair into curly hair.  Look for that review after I have used it a few more times.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: I do love the scent of this stuff
Review: I do love the scent of this stuff, and it took a couple of tries before I found the right amount for a conditioning treatment that didn't leave the hair too greasy, but once I figured that out, it worked nicely. My hair tends to get damage over time after coloring and this softened it up and made it much easier to comb through, but I find it does seem to weaken the color a bit.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Great fragrance, works well
Review: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Hair oil has a wonderful scent and worked great on my hair.  My hair gets frizzy in high humidity (hello, Georgia summers), and swimming does nothing to improve the situation.  This hair oil helped with both the frizz and the damage caused by chlorinated pool water, without leaving my hair heavy or greasy.  And since it has no mineral oil, I used it for my dry skin as well.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Beautiful Frangrance, Moisture and Shine
Review: Beautiful Frangrance, Moisture and ShineThis product will do what you expect, delivering moisture shine and a delicious fragrance. However, a little goes a long way.  Depending on your hair's needs, start with a little and add more as needed to avoid having a weighed down mess instead of the beautiful hair you expected. It will do what you expect delivering moisture shine and a delicious fragrance.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Not sure it works for me
Review: I love the aroma of the black vanilla which is the reason I picked this product. I have thick wavy/curly hair and wanted to soften the texture and increase the shine. Not quite sure it worked as well as I would have liked it to. I found that for myself it was heavy and greasy. My hair is heavy enough and I didn't appreciate the greasy shine.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I think that this oil smells good and makes my hair shinier - however I'm unhappy with how to get it out of my hair.  I had to wash my hair 3 times and it still looked greasy.  It smells great and if the oily look is something you are into I'd suggest this.  But, just for treating your hair and trying to make it healthier I wouldn't recommend it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: First thing I noticed with this hair oil is the Vanilla scent, It smells really good. Take a small in the palm of your hand and work it in both hands until warm then work your hands through your hair. It gives my hair life and shine without looking greasy. The Vanilla scent stays in my hair all day long so I get the benefit of both better looking hair that smells good too.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: I love this hair oil
Review: Oh my gosh, I love this hair oil. I have fine, dry, 3B curly hair, and a lot of oils on the market weigh my hair down too much. This one, which is 100% plant oil and contains no silicone, is surprisingly light on my hair, as long as I don’t use too much. It keeps my hair moisturized and soft, and it smells really lovely.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Not what I was looking for. But it's an awesome oil.
Review: I bought this one because it's suppose to be some sort of light hair moisturizer during the day.Didn't turn out what I was looking for, because my hair is to the oily side normally, and defiantly I didn't want to add oil mid day where it will look just greasy.But if you are looking for a light oil for the hair treatment, it will be perfect it have a nice smell, and the spray version is pretty light and you wouldn't have to worry about any mess or hands getting oily .I'd just spray abit extra all over my hair and leave it for awhile before my bath. I think it's great. If this is what you are looking for.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Very good product and a great selection to choose from
Review: I am so very very happy with this product my son locked my hair and turned me onto this product I would never go any other way and the prices are great

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: This is great! Although I usually don't like scented products, this is scented and I actually like the fragrance. My hair is colored, fine, thick and tends to dryness. This seems to "revive" it, without being greasy and makes it look healthier and more manageable. I wasn't sure what to expect, but I'm satisfied.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: 4/5 Really Good
Review: During the winters, my family - 3 girls - get really dry skin and hair. This works great for a 1-2 week treatment when it gets bad and really does seem to add back in the oils we need. Hair feels better and looks better. I recommend this!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Great for a dry scalp
Review: I use this as a scalp conditioner, since it is my scalp that dries out more than my hair.  Great smell, it is a very light oil that won't weigh your hair down.  It can be used during or after showering.  I use it when my hair and scalp are still a little wet for easier coverage.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Use very sparingly
Review: Use more than a drop and it's an oily mess. Great for moisturizing split ends.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Lovely - like the fountain of youth for my hair.
Review: Lovely. Smells wonderfully rich and vanilla-y. Leaves my hair soft and silky.  I have bi-racial - Asian and Caucasian - hair which is course, wavy, and can get slightly frizzy hair right after washing/air drying.  A few drops of this oil on my dry hair takes the frizz away.  If I swipe a flat iron after applying the oil then my hair is straight, shiny, silky and amazing.  I can't stop running my hands through my hair.  I've never been happier.  The only caveat I'll mention is that you need to apply sparingly (just a few drops per quarter head).

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Nice product. Goes easy on to the hair. My hair is super dry so I need something that can be easily applied. Gives the hair a nice shiny look. But I don't smell Vanilla. In fact I really don't smell anything. I wish the fragrance was a bit stronger.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Irritated my scalp
Review: I have locs and I purchased this oil because the one I usually get (Jiinsa) was out of stock. Used it for three days and my scalp developed these dry patches. My whole head is itchy, irritated, and sore. I’ve never had anything like this happen before but I won’t be using it again.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: All I would like to say is run not walk to the nearest ...
Review: I just finished washing my hair with black vanilla.  All I would like to say is run not walk to the nearest store to buy Carol's daughter products because they are the best.  This is my third time washing my hair with this product and feels so good and no breakage.  My only regret is that I haven't been using these products before.  Excellent,!! Finally there's product that actually does what it said it would do.  My hair feels so good and strong. No breakage and I it feels and looks healthy...  great product great product!!,

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Nice
Review: Works nicely to help with my frizzy hair. Easy to use and easy to shampoo out. This morning my hair feels nice and soft.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Smells amazing and does an excellent job of taming my daughter's frizzy/curly hair. A little goes a long way!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Never buy again worst ever
Review: The Smell is the best and only good thing about it

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: same great vanilla fragrance, much lighter than olive or castor oil
Review: This light oil smells 10x better than olive oil or castor and goes on easier because its a lighter oil. It has the same lovely vanilla fragrance that I love in the other products in this line.I apply a liberal amount in my palms and rub them together then I apply it from my roots to my ends. I only wish it wasn't so expensive. I also wish that the bottle was larger.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Pure Hair Oil For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Calendula, Chamomile and Safflower, Silicone Free Hair Oil, Paraben Free, 4.3 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Works okay but hard to heat
Review: I like this product in concept, but because it is in such a large bottle, it is not practical to warm the oil. I used to use tube treatments and those were easy to submerge in a cup of hot water to heat but this bottle is too large for that to be effective.

Title: but might be great for other hair types

Title: works for my hair
Review: This product smells nice (not too strong), and works to make my hair more curly, and hold the curl for a while. From reading other product reviews, I understand that not every product works for every head of hair.Another favorable feature of this product that I really appreciate is its spray mechanism with a LOCK, which is great for travel and avoiding spills.

Review: Works great for detangling but the smell is off-putting. I keep using it because it works so well. Would be perfect if they could work on the smell.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: Scent
Review: Great

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I very much dislike the fragrance of this product but that doesn’t mean that you won’t like it. It smells like white flowers. You can smell the tiare and gardenia quite strongly. It smells like kind of a heavy white flower fragrance to me. Reminds me of BB&W velvet tuberose fragrance. The smell dissipates a bit after drying but it stays pretty strong. I have not used it to heat style yet as I do that very rarely. It is not CG friendly so in combination with the fact that I don’t like the smell, I will drop it from my rotation. It has 3 different dimethicones and a drying alcohol in it. It left my curls a little weighed down but it looked pretty shiny. As a leave in, it dried a little hard but it was able to be scrunched without any flaking or anything.Please hit the button if this info was helpful.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I use this every time I run the straightener or curler through my hair. I have long, fine hair and it's so lifeless that styling is about the only thing I can do to bring the va-va-voom to it. Unfortunately, as a brunette, any time I have damage it shows up on the ends of my hair quite noticeably because of my hair color and the splits.This seems to be working well. I suspect it's the coconut oil in it. It's listed high up on the ingredient list, and it feels soft and silky in my hair. I mist my hair every time I get ready to use a styling tool, but I have also been using this as a general leave in conditioner since the coconut oil makes my hair feel so much nicer when I brush it through my hair. It seems like it gives me a little shine, too.The scent of this reminded me a salon, particularly the purple shimmering lights shampoo. It is a pleasant scent, and doesn't smell heavy like vanilla and lavenders often do. The ingredient list is what I'd call typical.
